revised_title: Quarks and Leptons: The New Elementary Particles? - A Review of the 1985 Royal Society Discussion Meeting
tldr: This article discusses a 1985 Royal Society discussion meeting about the new elementary particles, quarks, and leptons. It covers the current understanding of these particles, their interactions, and the progress towards unifying the fundamental forces of nature. The article also highlights the experimental methods used to study these particles and the future possibilities for particle physics research.
